segments.text: I see that the kitchen cabinets are filled with dishes, and yet the boy is fixated on that cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s strange how his world seems to revolve around those cookies, blind to everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: From my vantage point, the precarious stool wobbles, and I can't believe he hasn’t noticed it yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if he falls? The thought makes my heart race as I silently urge him to come down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I see the girl beside him, and her eagerness softens the moment; it’s a reminder of childhood innocence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Still, her lack of caution troubles me; she doesn’t seem to realize the potential for harm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Sometimes I wonder how long they can keep this up before something goes wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR
